p: In our research, a classification into commercial cultivated and wild mushrooms was adopted in the literature; the most studied species for Î²-glucan content are commercial cultivated mushrooms the Pleurotus, Lentinula and Agaricus genus, mainly due to the good accessibility of the test material. Among the Pleurotus genus, Pleurotus ostreatus, Pleurotus eringa, Pleurotus djamor Pleurotus ferule, Pleurotus nebrodensis, and Pleurotus sapidus, popular in China, Korea and Japan but less known in Poland, were studied as well. Among the Lentinula genus, the most studied is Lentinula edodes, and among the Agaricus genus, different varieties of Agaricus bisporus [ 31, 43, 66].
